title: Blended Instructional Design Course for Acquiring Ophthalmic Surgical Techniques

context.prior_knowledge: Basic anatomy, surgical suturing techniques, and foundational knowledge of common ophthalmic conditions
context.additional_context: Hybrid structure combining smartphone-based theoretical learning with monthly in-person practicums in environments with limited lab access. Emphasizes a step-by-step skill acquisition system applying Gagné’s Nine Events of Instruction

learning_goals: Perform four core ophthalmic surgical skills (corneal suturing, corneal adhesion, intravitreal injection, eyelid suturing) with 90% accuracy
Reduce surgical step errors by 70% according to Gagné’s nine-stage learning model
Achieve over 85 points (out of 100) in understanding surgical principles through smartphone-based theoretical learning materials

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
